newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Zim Israel Q4 net loss $13.8 mln vs profit.
newsitem.headline: Zim Israel Q4 net loss $13.8 mln vs profit.

text.p: The 1996 loss was after provision for deferred taxes of $6.3 million, the company said.
In 1996 the company carried 912,353 TEUs against 873,074 in 1995. Zim operated 80 vssels.
Zim cited other factors which negatively affected the results:
- The growing gap between supply of space and demand of cargo volume causing "fierce competition" in the Israeli and international trade, resulting in growing erosion in freight rates.
- Due to difficulties in utilising carrying capacity, large container shipping companies active in East-West routes began entering secondary trade areas including Israel.
- Delays in Israeli and foreign ports and a $6 million increase in fuel expenses.

Zim said it has been taking efficiency steps to increase income and reduce expenses. It is expanding strategic alliances with other shipping companies operating in the same trade areas, while increasing marketing in various areas.
Zim is 51 percent controlled by Israel Corp. The remaining shares are owned by the government, which has said shares in Zim are among the first it intends to sell.
